result.execSummary:
The defendant Patrick A. Brown was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st Reckless Homicide/Deliver Drugs, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is eligible for both the Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.
02/15/16 - Per Department of Corrections, the Defendant is NOT eligible for both the Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program

superMiscConds.notes: The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, restitution and surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.   Penalty for non-payment shall be entry of civil judgment.   Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 423, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808.

Follow assessment recommendations.
Follow rules and pay fees of supervision.  
No poss or consumption of illegal controlled substances or drug para without a valid presciprtion.
Absolute Sobriety
Submit DNA sample.
Defendant shall not enter any establishment in which their primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Pay costs monthly. 
Court authorizes early termination of Extended Supervision after three years.

supervisions.notes: 04/20/20 - Lenth of Extended Supervision amended to allow request for early termination.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

02:30 PM Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court with attorney Tracy Ann Paider.  Probation and Parole by agent Megan Kaschek in court. Defendant Patrick A. Brown in court.  Pursuant to the AMENDED Supreme Court Order issued April 15, 2020,  in response to Governor Evers declaring a public health emergency for the State of Wisconsin in connection with the COVID-19 pandemic; ALL PERSONAL IN COURT APPEARANCES ARE SUSPENDED AT THIS TIME.  PARTIES APPEAR VIA VIDEO OR TELEPHONE CONFERENCING THROUGH ZOOM.  Regarding early Defendant's request for early discharge from supervision.  State does not object, victim rights complied with.  Court will grant request for early termination.

Motion hearing on April 20, 2020 at 02:30 pm.

  Pursuant to Wisconsin Supreme Court Order issued March 22, 2020, this hearing is being held via video and/or by telephone conference.  You may view the live stream of this hearing through the following YouTube link:
